results.title: Business Manager - Evercoach
results.description:
The world is changing faster than ever before. Evercoach works on empowering the next generation of coaches and leaders who are being called to adapt and thrive in the new global landscape. Established in 2015, they are now leading the industry with cutting-edge coaching and business training that create a massive impact in the lives of their clients!

Their team of 15 core team members is spread across India, Malaysia, Israel, Tallinn, Canada and Costa Rica.

Evercoach is looking for a Business Manager to manage the operations of the company.

In this role, you will:

  • Manage contracts and timelines to send them to authors and clients
  • Coordinate with the finance team to tally books and answer related questions
  • Hire and do outreach for hiring
  • Make sure vendor payments are made correctly and on time
  • Manage meeting agendas and takeaways for team members
  • Help with overall systems and processes

During the first few weeks in the role, you will learn more about the company and work directly with the CEO on executing tasks around contracts and finance.

This is a full-time role, and you‚Äôll be free to create your own schedule as long as you can have some overlap with the rest of the team and attend team meetings.

Requirements

To be successful in this role, you need:

  • Experience in project management and operations
  • Experience working in online companies with remote team members
  • Knowledge of Google Suite
  • Ability to work within a fast-growing environment where things are rapidly changing - one day is not like the next and you need to figure things out as you go :)

Our ideal candidate is curious and enthusiastic, with the patience to join a fast-growing startup at the ground level, and potentially grow into the COO position.

Benefits

Here are the benefits:

  • $3000 - $4000* per month
  • Full-time & fully remote
  • Paid trips to company events based on performance
  • Paid yearly team retreat
  • Salary bonuses & increases based on performance
  • Potential to advance to a COO or CEO role

*Please note that this is a gross salary and that you are responsible for any tax-related procedures in your country of residence. We kindly ask you to apply only if you are happy to work remotely as an independent contractor.


This position will be closed as soon as we find the perfect match. So, make sure to read the description carefully and take your time to submit a high-quality application that stands out.

If you apply, JobRack will respond promptly and keep you updated throughout the process.

Please expect the hiring process to include:

1 - Filling in the application form once you click ‚ÄúApply‚Äù

2 - Being invited to record a short video to introduce yourself

3 - Completing test tasks, if short-listed

4 - Attending video interviews where you will have the opportunity to talk more about your previous experience and the new role

Applications are only accepted through JobRack. Evercoach has specifically requested that you do not contact them directly. If you have any questions please contact us using dwy@jobrack.eu

To make sure you receive updates on your application please add recruitment@jobrack.eu to your email address book.


Got questions about working remotely? Check out JobRack‚Äôs FAQ for answers to everything you might want to know. https://jobrack.eu/jobseeker-faq

results.title: Brand Production Designer
results.description:
About the Company

Makeship exists to empower influencers, creators, and brands of all sizes to develop and launch limited edition products that matter to their fans. Leveraging our design, manufacturing, and marketing expertise, we work with our partners to bring their product to life through our community-powered crowd-funding platform. Each product is given a window of 21 days to be funded by the community before we produce and ship to fans worldwide. We put our brand behind every product and guarantee quality and ethical sourcing. We're profitable, have grown the team from 2 to 70 people in 4 years, and we‚Äôre growing at an average annual growth rate of 200%+.

About the Role

As an early member of the team, you‚Äôll play a huge role in shaping our culture, our process, and the future of Makeship. Every day, you‚Äôll collaborate, learn more about the content creation space, and watch your work make an impact (on the company and their community!).

We want this to be the best work experience of your life, so we‚Äôll pay you well, offer great benefits, invest deeply in your growth, and welcome you with our branded swag.

What We Are Looking For

We are looking for a rockstar Brand Production Designer who‚Äôll be a core ambassador in streamlining Makeship‚Äôs Marketing, Ecommerce and Brand Development efforts. We are looking for a self-starter, with high technical proficiency in both print and digital production. As a Brand Production Designer, you'll work alongside the Brand Creative team to standardize and optimize all creative tools, design templates and Makeship branded initiatives. You will also be joining one of Canada's fastest-growing start-up companies!

Your Key Responsibilities
  • Collaborate within the Brand Creative Team to optimize brand guidelines and templates for our in-house design teams (Adobe CC, Figma)
  • Develop and maintain branded pitch decks and company-wide presentation templates (Indesign, Canva)
  • Collaborate with the manufacturing team in developing packaging tech-packs (Illustrator), production troubleshooting and providing virtual press approvals
  • Assist in the post-production and digital asset management of all product and marketing campaign imagery
  • Work alongside the Digital Marketing team in the development and optimization of email content and templates (Figma, Klaviyo)
  • Overseeing the delivery of static and video content for ecommerce, digital advertising and social media
  • Work alongside the Brand Communications Designer and Social Media team in the development and onboarding of new content templates (Photoshop, Canva)
  • Work alongside the Senior Brand Designer in the development of branded pop-up activations
  • Organization and cataloging of all Brand Creative team assets
  • Act as the author and gatekeeper of all internal Brand Production documentation, processes and best practices (Notion, Guru)
What You Bring
  • Minimum 3+ years of production experience in a design agency or in-house business environment
  • Technical mastery of Adobe Illustrator, Indesign and Photoshop
  • Proficiency in UI production design for development (Figma)
  • Proficiency in video/motion design production (After Effects, Premiere Pro)
  • Experience creating user-friendly branded tools/templates for company-wide use (Canva, Notion)
  • An open and collaborative energy (We are a small and mighty team!)
  • An insatiable curiosity and enthusiasm for all things Brand
  • Ability to learn and adapt quickly, within a fast-paced growth environment
  • Exceptional organizational skills
  • A keen eye for details, with a commitment to excellence of execution
  • Experience in UX design is an asset
  • Experience in 3D content/rendering is an asset (Dimensions, Origami, Marmoset)
Benefits & Perks
  • Work remotely anywhere in Canada and/or access any of our hubs
  • Health and dental benefits
  • 3 weeks of paid vacation
  • 1 week of paid time off during the holidays
  • 2 mental health and wellness days
  • Paid time off on your birthday
  • Monthly phone allowance
  • $400 home office setup allowance
  • Pregnancy and parental leave top-up program
  • Learning and development opportunities
  • Employee referral program

Makeship is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, colour, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status.

results.title: Web Engineer
results.description:
At Attio, we‚Äôre building the CRM of the future‚Ä¶

CRMs are at the center of the software stack for millions of businesses. They're ubiquitous and totally essential, yet current products are completely archaic, unloved, and in massive need of an overhaul.

This is software that millions of people use for hours and hours a day and you probably can't think of a single awesome piece of software in this space.

Attio‚Äôs singular focus is to revolutionize one of the world‚Äôs most important and entrenched software categories: CRM.

We‚Äôll need the world‚Äôs best engineers to solve some of the toughest engineering problems; we‚Äôll need visionary designers to create the best experiences, and we‚Äôll need creative marketers and ambitious salespeople to tell our story and bring our product to market.

¬†
Why is this role important?

As a Web Engineer at Attio you will take ownership for all web-related tasks including developing Attio.com and helping with a wide range of growth-related initiatives.

We are particularly interested in hearing from:

  • Engineers with experience in growing customers for a product through the .com experience
  • Engineers with excellent UI and product sense
¬†
Whose team will you join?

You will join our Activation Team within engineering and focus on activating customers through Attio.com. We have four other product teams in engineering.

Internally, we work around two fundamental principles: Curiosity and Ownership. These values transcend the way we work and how our teams are structured.

We embrace Curiosity with a culture of open discussion and open access - making everything from financial metrics and customer conversation through to code and tooling open to every member of the team. Everyone on the team is welcome to question any aspect of the business and build greater understanding and input.

Through Ownership teams are responsible not just for the technical aspects of their work but also their own product and roadmap decisions. Everything from technical debt decisions through to feature planning is carried out at the team level.

In a culture without PM‚Äôs or tight deadlines, we are able to think from first principles and support each other across projects.

¬†
What is it like to work at Attio?

Attio employees are currently based in the UK, Europe and the US.

We are all trusted to produce high quality work in the remote-first environment that works best for us. Kindness is evident in how we work and there is a high level of respect across the team thanks to working hard. This allows us all to challenge ideas, be independent and attract world class talent to join us.

A job at Attio is for someone who can own their role and the learning required, train themselves, create a network of support and deliver consistently brilliant outcomes that push the company forward. People who are passionate and happy about working this way should apply.

Requirements

What are the role requirements?

In this role, you will be expected to:

  • Contribute across the stack to help move the company and product forward
  • Build the frontend architecture for Attio.com enabling pixel-perfect implementation alongside Attio‚Äôs design team
  • Implement beautiful & performant designs across devices using React, Typescript, CSS
  • Consider SEO, accessibility, marketing, and customers on the Activation Team roadmap
  • Collaborate through excellent written communication, supporting a growing team
¬†
We believe the right person will have the following attributes:
  • Curious: Are they inherently curious about SaaS, websites, sales, marketing, design?
  • Thoughtful: Patiently understands the problem, thinking, challenges and customers
  • Fearless: Pushes innovation and ideas through to fruition
  • Resourceful: Powers through smaller tasks and delivers roadmap
¬†
What does the hiring process look like?

We respond to applicants before the end of each week and within 24 hours of each interview, we will request and share feedback at every stage.

Applicants can expect the following:

  1. Introductory phone call ~ 30 minutes
  2. Interview ~ 45 minutes
  3. Exercise ~ Take home + 60 minutes discussion
  4. Offer stage

A lot of our interviews are enabled through self-scheduling but we are always on hand to speak to you or answer questions throughout the process. At the offer stage, you may want to speak to more of the team, see a demo or have other suggestions for us.

Everyone who completes at least one of the above stages will be asked to provide feedback on the overall process and offered some help on their career if it's not joining Attio at this time.

Benefits

What will an offer consist of?
  • A competitive salary of between ¬£50,000 - ¬£75,000 or equivalent ‚Ç¨/$
  • Equity in an early-stage tech company on an incredible trajectory
  • Remote working and flexibility
  • Apple hardware and a budget for desk amenities
  • 25 days plus local holidays
  • Regular team events in London
  • Team off-site in fun places! (We've been to Lisbon and Malta so far)
  • Enhanced parental leave

Moodle with us!

We‚Äôve built a passionate team of hard-working, driven and diverse people from all over the world, united by a shared belief in the ability of our platform to make a positive difference to our world. Learn more about your new workplace...

Moodle is the world‚Äôs most trusted online learning solution, with a growing ecosystem of products and services, including Moodle Workplace, Moodle App, MoodleCloud, and more. The engine of our ecosystem is Moodle LMS, the secure and customisable open source learning management platform used by well over 300 million learners worldwide.

At Moodle we are an equal opportunity employer that actively supports diversity and inclusion in the workplace and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any kind. results.title: Developer Experience Engineer
results.description:
IO Global is searching for a DevX engineer to join the developer experience team. As a DevX Engineer, you are in charge of ensuring that our development teams are happy, effective, and productive. This involves using, creating, and configuring various tools and frameworks to make development easier, all the way from writing the software to building and preparing it for deployment. You will also focus on administration of the source control system. You work closely with the developers, quality assurance, and the SRE team in order to define, improve, and maintain our software delivery process.

DevX engineers form the support backbone for developers at IOG, and may occasionally help outside developers interacting with IOG products. The DevX roles are very versatile and need a good programming foundation. The job involves working the whole stack, from low-level issues in CI to high-level documentation. The ideal candidate is an all around generalist with solid experience in various languages and tools.

Your mission

  • Create, maintain, document, and optimize automated build processes
  • Create and maintain internal tools to support development or build workflows, including advanced systems to improve our build and development processes across the organization.
  • Work with the development team to set up and maintain functional and effective development build environment
  • Support the QA team in the definition of continuous testing processes and validation pipelines
  • Support the needs of the SRE team and contribute to the definition of reliable continuous integration pipelines
  • Contribute to the administration of the source version control system and to managing users, groups, permissions, and general instance configuration of the source control.

We are hiring DevX Engineers for the following teams:

Marlowe

Daedalus

Lace

Atala

Requirements

Your expertise

  • System administration experience (Nix preferably)
  • Experience working in internal tooling teams or SRE/DevOps previously
  • Languages used in each team is below, require experience of their common build, packaging, and deployment tools
  • Marlowe - Haskell
  • Daedalus - JavaScript/TypeScript/Haskell
  • Lace - JavaScript/TypeScript
  • Atala - Scala/Kotlin/Swift/ObjC/TypeScript/JavaScript

Benefits

Location

IOG is a fully distributed organization and therefore this is a remote position.

All Colleagues

  • Flexible schedule
  • Remote work - ability to work anywhere
  • Laptop reimbursement
  • New starter package to buy hardware essentials (headphones, monitor, etc)
  • Learning & Development opportunities
  • Competitive PTO and Sick Leave plan

US Employees

  • Medical, Dental, and Vision benefits coverage through Anthem with 100% premium cost covered by IO Global for the employee and dependents

  • Life Insurance

UK Employees

  • Monthly Health Stipend to use towards any wellness or medical coverage/service
  • Pension
